definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: A foreign party is encouraged to deposit in the Bank of China any part of foreign exchange which he is entitled to remit abroad.
sentences.chinese: 鼓励外国合营者将可汇出的外汇存入中国银行。

sentences.english: Residents remitting outward funds to redeem his global depository receipts.
sentences.chinese: 居民为赎回其海外存托凭证所汇出之资金。

sentences.english: Issuance of stocks in the R. O. C. by foreign nationals.
sentences.chinese: 非居民在台公开发行股票募集资金汇出。

sentences.english: Outward remittances of interest from deposits in R. O. C banks by non-residents.
sentences.chinese: 非居民汇出在国内存款之利息所得。

definition: to transfer (money to a bank account)
to withdraw money/to take money out of the bank
to withdraw money from a bank
